page.title: 04LONGRIDGE ESTATE, KNUTSFORD
page.content: The Longridge Estate was built in the late 1960's. There are about 400 houses and flats, all brick built with tiled roofs. The houses belong to Manchester City Council and most of the people who live here came from Manchester. In the centre of the estate there is a public house, 3 shops and a doctor's surgery. The shops are a newsagents, a supermarket, a take-away food shop. Our school is at one end of the estate and children from Shaw Heath estate also come here. At the other end is a small trading estate which houses small businesses such as printing and advertising, kitchen furniture making, tyre and battery sales and a Chinese owned firm making louvre doors. There is a grass play area which we don't use very much.
